sentences: Kellelegi pahandusi teha - someone's troubles to make/cause
Ta ei taha kellegile pahandusi teha - He doesn't want to cause trouble for anyone
See mees on alati kellegile pahandusi tegemas - This man is always causing trouble for someone
context: The word 'pahandusi' is the partitive plural form of 'pahandus', meaning troubles or problems. It typically appears in constructions like 'kellegi pahandusi teha' which means to cause trouble/problems for someone. The root 'paha-' indicates something negative or bad, and '-ndus' forms nouns indicating states or conditions. In this context, it refers to creating difficulties or annoyances for others.
